alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 2:36PM CST until January 20 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...QUICK HIT OF SNOW THIS AFTERNOON, FOLLOWED BY SOME BLOWING SNOW INTO TONIGHT AND THEN MORE BITTERLY COLD WIND CHILLS... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory this evening into Friday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory for Friday evening into Saturday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 again expected, although wind speeds will only be around 10 MPH or less. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to the dangerous wind chill concerns these next few nights, please note that a quick hit of snow this afternoon could reduce visibility and cause slick roads for the evening commute in parts of the area. However, total snow accumulations will remain well under 1 inch.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
